avalancheActivity.comment:
From the late morning as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be only a slight increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches, caution is to be exercised in particular in steep rocky terrain below approximately 2600 m. In steep gullies moist avalanches can reach medium size.
The wind slabs of the last few days are lying on weak layers in high Alpine regions. They can still be released in some cases in particular on northwest to northeast to east facing aspects above approximately 2500 m.
There is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface. This applies in particular in the early morning.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches in the course of the day. Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released especially by large additional loads on shady slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The conditions are wintry at high altitude. Individual weak layers exist in the snowpack on shady slopes. Adjacent to ridgelines hardly any snow is lying.
Low and intermediate altitudes and very steep sunny slopes: The conditions are spring-like. Less snow than usual is lying. The high temperatures gave rise to moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2500 m.

tendency.comment: The weather conditions will foster a gradual strengthening of the snowpack.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Very early morning: There is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
As a consequence of warming during the day more small and medium-sized moist snow slides and avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m, caution is to be exercised in particular in steep rocky terrain.
Isolated avalanche prone weak layers exist in the top section of the snowpack on shady slopes. They can still be released in some cases in particular on northwest to northeast to east facing aspects above approximately 2500 m. This applies in particular in case of a large load.
avalancheActivity.highlights: More moist avalanches are possible as the day progresses. Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released especially by large additional loads on shady slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The conditions are wintry at high altitude. In particular adjacent to ridgelines snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Weak layers exist in the centre of the snowpack on steep shady slopes.
Low and intermediate altitudes and very steep sunny slopes: The conditions are spring-like. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2600 m.
Less snow than usual is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of warming during the day more mostly small moist snow slides and avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m, in the event of solar radiation in particular on rocky slopes.
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in very isolated cases by people on very steep shady slopes, in particular in the vicinity of peaks above approximately 2400 m. The avalanche prone locations are rather rare but are difficult to recognise.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in high Alpine regions. Moist snow slides and avalanches are still possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
On steep sunny slopes as well as at low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to slight moistening of the snowpack in particular on steep southeast, south and southwest facing slopes below approximately 2500 m.
In very isolated cases weak layers exist in the centre of the snowpack on steep shady slopes.

tendency.comment: The weather conditions will foster a gradual strengthening of the snowpack.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Very early morning: In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
As a consequence of warming during the day individual mostly small moist snow slides and avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular in steep rocky terrain.
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in isolated cases by winter sport participants in particular on very steep shady slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in high Alpine regions. Moist snow slides and avalanches are still possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The snowpack is largely stable. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to slight moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2500 m.
In all regions only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
